answers.a: The sum of the diffusion residual current.
answers.b: Average diffusion current during the life of the drop.
answers.c: The current that exist in between the limiting diffusion plateau and the residual current.
answers.d: Non faradaic current at the foot of the wave.

explanations.a: Correct. The limiting current is primarily the diffusion current, which includes the residual component.
explanations.b: Not entirely accurate; diffusion current is the main component but not just the average.
explanations.c: Describes the diffusion current range but not the definition of limiting current.
explanations.d: This defines residual current, not limiting current.

questions.question: Ilkovic equation can be best described by the equation:

answers.a: id = 78 n D²⁄³ m³⁄² t²⁄³ c
answers.b: id = 708 n D¹⁄² m²⁄³ t¹⁄⁶ c
answers.c: id = 708 n D²⁄³ m¹⁄² t¹⁄⁶ c
answers.d: id = 78 n D²⁄³ m¹⁄² t¹⁄³ c

explanations.a: Incorrect form, coefficients and powers are inaccurate.
explanations.c: Correct form of Ilkovic equation (standard version).

questions.question: In polarographic technique the formation of the new drop is controlled by

explanations.a: Used in the setup but not involved in drop formation.
explanations.b: Common electrode but unrelated to drop control.
explanations.c: Describes the container, not the drop mechanism.
explanations.d: Correct. The capillary tube controls the mercury drop formation.
